content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. Multiple recovery updates attempted to supply a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) for research purposes, but all lab placement or crafting operations failed due to missing inventory items and insufficient sub-ingredients. In parallel, the agent interacted with existing furnaces to process raw materials:
• An alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) was used for smelting iron plates.
• A copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) was used for copper plate production.
These furnace interactions served processing purposes only and did not result in new structure placement (the final entities on the map remain None).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Usage:
  – When calling get_entities, use the prescribed function signature. Avoid providing unexpected keywords (e.g. remove the 'radius' keyword) and extra positional arguments to prevent type errors.
  
• Iteration on API Results:
  – Validate that API calls return an iterable (e.g. ensure the returned value is not None) before attempting to iterate over the list of entities. Use a fallback to an empty list if necessary.
  
• Inventory and Placement Verification:
  – Before attempting to place a Lab (or any structure), verify that the corresponding item is present in the inventory to avoid placement errors.
  
• Crafting Resource Checks:
  – Prior to initiating lab crafting, confirm that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are sufficiently available. Ensure that prerequisite processes (like smelting sufficient iron and copper plates) have been completed successfully to support the full crafting chain.
